verses.verse: If a man <S%H376><s%> shall steal <S%H1589><s%> an ox <S%H7794><s%>, or a sheep <S%H7716><s%>, and kill <S%H2873><s%> it <S%H4376><s%>, or sell it <S%H7999><s%>; he shall restore five <S%H2568><s%> oxen <S%H1241><s%> for an ox <S%H7794><s%>, and four <S%H702><s%> sheep <S%H6629><s%> for a sheep <S%H7716><s%>.
If a thief <S%H1590><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%> breaking in <S%H4290><s%>, and be struck <S%H5221><s%> that he die <S%H4191><s%>, there shall no blood be shed for him <S%H1818><s%>.

If the sun <S%H8121><s%> be risen <S%H2224><s%> upon him <S%H1818><s%>, there shall be blood shed for him <S%H7999><s%>; for he should make full restitution <S%H7999><s%>; if he have nothing <S%H4376><s%>, then he shall be sold for his theft <S%H1591><s%>.

If the theft <S%H1591><s%> be certainly <S%H4672><s%> found <S%H4672><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%> alive <S%H2416><s%>, whether it be ox <S%H7794><s%>, or donkey <S%H2543><s%>, or sheep <S%H7716><s%>; he shall restore <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> shall cause a field <S%H7704><s%> or vineyard <S%H3754><s%> to be eaten <S%H1197><s%>, and shall put <S%H7971><s%> in his animal <S%H1165><s%>, and shall feed <S%H1197><s%> in another man <S%H312><s%>'s field <S%H7704><s%>; of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own field <S%H7704><s%>, and of the best <S%H4315><s%> of his own vineyard <S%H3754><s%>, shall he make restitution <S%H7999><s%>.

If fire <S%H784><s%> break out <S%H3318><s%>, and catch <S%H4672><s%> in thorns <S%H6975><s%>, so that the stacks of corn <S%H1430><s%>, or the standing corn <S%H7054><s%>, or the field <S%H7704><s%>, be consumed <S%H398><s%> therewith <S%H1197><s%>; he that kindled the fire <S%H1200><s%> shall surely <S%H7999><s%> make restitution <S%H7999><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> shall deliver <S%H5414><s%> unto his two <S%H7453><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> or stuff <S%H3627><s%> to keep <S%H8104><s%>, and it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> out of the man <S%H376><s%>'s house <S%H1004><s%>; if the thief <S%H1590><s%> be found <S%H4672><s%>, let him pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%>.

If the thief <S%H1590><s%> be not <S%H3808><s%> found <S%H4672><s%>, then the master <S%H1167><s%> of the house <S%H1004><s%> shall be brought <S%H7126><s%> unto the judges <S%H430><s%>, to see whether he have put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> unto his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>'s goods <S%H4399><s%>.

For all manner <S%H1697><s%> of trespass <S%H6588><s%>, whether it be for ox <S%H7794><s%>, for donkey <S%H2543><s%>, for sheep <S%H7716><s%>, for stew <S%H8008><s%>, or for any manner of lost thing <S%H9><s%>, which another challengeth <S%H559><s%> to be his <S%H1697><s%>, the cause of both parties <S%H8147><s%> shall come <S%H935><s%> before the judges <S%H430><s%>; and whom the judges <S%H430><s%> shall condemn <S%H7561><s%>, he shall pay <S%H7999><s%> double <S%H8147><s%> unto his two <S%H7453><s%>.

If a man <S%H376><s%> deliver <S%H5414><s%> unto his two <S%H7453><s%> a donkey <S%H2543><s%>, or an ox <S%H7794><s%>, or a sheep <S%H7716><s%>, or any animal <S%H929><s%>, to keep <S%H8104><s%>; and it die <S%H4191><s%>, or be hurt <S%H7665><s%>, or driven away <S%H7617><s%>, no man seeing it <S%H7200><s%>:

Then shall an oath <S%H7621><s%> of the Lord <S%H3068><s%> be between them both <S%H8147><s%>, that he has not put <S%H7971><s%> his hand <S%H3027><s%> unto his neighbour <S%H7453><s%>'s goods <S%H4399><s%>; and the owner <S%H1167><s%> of it shall accept <S%H3947><s%> there and he shall not make it good <S%H7999><s%>.
And if it be stolen <S%H1589><s%> from him <S%H7999><s%>, he shall make restitution unto the owner there <S%H1167><s%>
If it be torn in pieces <S%H2963><s%>, then let him bring <S%H935><s%> it for witness <S%H5707><s%>, and he shall not make good <S%H7999><s%> that which was torn <S%H2966><s%>.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> borrow <S%H7592><s%> commits of his two <S%H7453><s%>, and it be hurt <S%H7665><s%>, or die <S%H4191><s%>, the owner <S%H1167><s%> there being not with it <S%H5973><s%>, he shall surely <S%H7999><s%> make it good <S%H7999><s%>.
But if the owner <S%H1167><s%> there be with it <S%H7999><s%>, he shall not make it good: if it be an hired <S%H7916><s%> thing <S%H935><s%>, it came for his hire <S%H7939><s%>.

And if a man <S%H376><s%> entice <S%H6601><s%> a maid <S%H1330><s%> that is not married <S%H781><s%>, and lie <S%H7901><s%> with her <S%H4117><s%>, he shall surely endow <S%H4117><s%> her to be his wife <S%H802><s%>.

If her father <S%H1><s%> utterly <S%H3985><s%> refuse <S%H3985><s%> to give <S%H5414><s%> her unto him <S%H8254><s%>, he shall pay money <S%H3701><s%> according to the dowry <S%H4119><s%> of virgins <S%H1330><s%>.
You shall not allow a witch <S%H3784><s%> to live <S%H2421><s%>.
Whoever lies <S%H7901><s%> with a animal <S%H929><s%> shall surely <S%H4191><s%> be put to death <S%H4191><s%>.
He that sacrifices <S%H2076><s%> unto any god <S%H430><s%>, except <S%H1115><s%> unto the Lord <S%H3068><s%> only <S%H2763><s%>, he shall be utterly destroyed.
You shall neither wrong <S%H3238><s%> a stranger <S%H1616><s%>, nor oppress <S%H3905><s%> him <S%H1616><s%>: for you were strangers in the land <S%H776><s%> of Egypt <S%H4714><s%>.
You shall not afflict <S%H6031><s%> any widow <S%H490><s%>, or fatherless child <S%H3490><s%>.

If <S%H518><s%> you afflict <S%H6031><s%> them in any wise <S%H6031><s%>, and they cry <S%H6817><s%> at all <S%H6817><s%> unto me <S%H8085><s%>, I will surely hear <S%H8085><s%> their cry <S%H6818><s%>;

And my wrath <S%H639><s%> shall wax hot <S%H2734><s%>, and I will kill <S%H2026><s%> you with the sword <S%H2719><s%>; and your wives <S%H802><s%> shall be widows <S%H490><s%>, and your sons <S%H1121><s%> fatherless <S%H3490><s%>.

If you lend <S%H3867><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> to any of my people <S%H5971><s%> that is poor <S%H6041><s%> by you you shall not be to him as a creditor <S%H5383><s%>, neither shall you lay <S%H7760><s%> upon him interest <S%H5392><s%>.

If you at all <S%H2254><s%> take <S%H2254><s%> your neighbour <S%H7453><s%>'s clothes <S%H8008><s%> to pledge <S%H2254><s%>, you shall deliver <S%H7725><s%> it unto him before <S%H5704><s%> that the sun <S%H8121><s%> goes down <S%H935><s%>:

For that is his covering <S%H3682><s%> only <S%H8071><s%>, it is his clothes for his skin <S%H5785><s%>: where shall he sleep <S%H7901><s%>? and it shall come to pass <S%H6817><s%>, when he cries unto me <S%H8085><s%>, that I will hear; for I am gracious <S%H2587><s%>.
You shall not revile <S%H7043><s%> God <S%H430><s%>, nor curse <S%H779><s%> the ruler <S%H5387><s%> of your people <S%H5971><s%>.

You shall not delay <S%H309><s%> to offer the first of your ripe fruits <S%H4395><s%>, and of your juices <S%H1831><s%>: the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> of your sons <S%H1121><s%> shall you give unto me <S%H5414><s%>.

Likewise <S%H3651><s%> shall you do <S%H6213><s%> with your oxen <S%H7794><s%>, and with your sheep <S%H6629><s%>: seven <S%H7651><s%> days <S%H3117><s%> it shall be with his mother <S%H517><s%>; on the eighth <S%H8066><s%> day <S%H3117><s%> you shall give it me <S%H5414><s%>.

And you shall be holy <S%H6944><s%> men <S%H582><s%> unto me <S%H398><s%>: neither shall you eat any flesh <S%H1320><s%> that is torn of animals <S%H2966><s%> in the field <S%H7704><s%>; you shall cast <S%H7993><s%> it to the dogs <S%H3611><s%>.
